column2: LMo, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Well I must be a lucky one, prenate elite comes in a bottle so I don't have to tear open the package...althoug morning sickness was dreadful during my pregnancy, the pill made me less sick than any other prenatal vitamin. My hair and nails grew like crazy...I think they added about 4 inches to my hair. I have had my baby, she is 9 months now, and I still take the pills everyday. Hair is still growing....I take them at night and that has worked for me!! They are great!!!

column2: Soon to be mommy of 2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took prenate with my first pregnancy that started in july of 2007. The packaging was a bit of a hassle sometimes when the white paper would tear before you could get to the pill. But to my surprise, I went to pick up a new rx for my current pregnancy and they've done away with the individual wrapping and put them all in a bottle! Most of the complaints here were with the packaging. Overall  I never had problems, and this vitamin was my main choice because of the added iron that helped with my anemia.

column2: alannanicole, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The packaging isn't "hard" just extremely annoying, I just got the pharmacy to give me a bottle with a label so I could peel the full supply out of the package and put in the bottle... so it only got annoying when I had to refill. I had extremely bad morning sickness at the beginning of my pregnancy leaving me in bed for days at a time, and these vitamins was the only one that reduced the morning sickness. My biggest complaint however, it took me a long time to figure out timing of taking this medicine because I found that taking it in the morning led to me burping all day... and the burps taste/smell like TAR! It was disgusting, I finally figured out that when I have an GIANT glass of milk with the pill I can take it in the morning and not burp all day. The milk is good for the baby, so win/win!

column2: emilycc, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: have had bloating and very odd upper stomach cramps ever since i went on them - feels like an upset stomach but higher than abdomen..really uncomfortable. i thought i was becoming allergic to lactose or something, but have since realized these symptoms started after taking the pre-natal vitimins.

column2: me,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had terrible cramps and constipation while taking prenate. The package is a hassle, but not impossible. I will be better off taking a vitamin that is easier on my system.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: package is difficult to open. Take with a lot of water or juice. Made my poo turn blackish-green. This was the one vitamin that didn't make me queasy. Overall, I am  satisfied.

column2: Mama, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: If you try to open this pill using the precut marks in the foil, it could be a pain.  However, if you peel back the white paper, you can push the pill right through the foil with zero difficulty.  I have been very sick since I got pregnant so I don't think I can offer a reasonable opinion on how Prenate makes me feel.  I just hope it's helping me develop a healthy baby.  There was a question about whether or not Prenate contains Folic Acid.  It does.  It is in it's broken-down form, which makes it far easier to digest, called Folate.  Many people do not reap the benefits of taking Folic Acid because they simply cannot break it down effectively.  Prenate does that for you.  Thanks to everyone sharing their thoughts and opinions, and I hoped I've helped someone by sharing mine.

column2: kntpounders, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it has worked for me, and i actually feel great...packaging was difficult at first, thats because i fought it, but really...pull the white paper off exsposing the foil and pop it thru...wala!

column2: aflo, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Before pregnancy, I would feel fine when taking the vitamin.  A few weeks after confirming I was pregnent, the vitamin would make me sick, no matter if it was with an empty stomach or with food. Also, it makes going to the bathroom difficult. It's also hard to get out of the package.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I didn't find the package hard to open. It did cause abdominal cramps and bloating though.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Didn't have any trouble opening the package. The package says, "peel and push". I do however want to know if it contains folic acid? It doesn't say on the package.

column2: hellosunshine, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I don't know why everyone is having such a hard time with the packaging, You peel and push the pill out - it's that simple. I feel a lot better with this one, no morning sickness, no hives or pimples, my nails and hair are growing and I feel great. Bowl Movements have become so easy, I'm finally not afraid to go anymore. I do drink a lot of water and tea though.

column2: Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This vitamin made bowel movements difficult and less frequent.  Both my bowel movements and me pee were very dark.  The package was very difficult to open.  All symptoms went away after switching to a different vitamin.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After being on the pill for several weeks, I began retaining water and experienced black stool.  I do agree that the package is horrible to get open.  I have to use a knife.

column2: Hlh1990@aol.com, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ever since ive been taking this  ive not been able to use the bathroon very well.  My pee smells funny. The pill is hard to get out

column2: annyce415, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: I broke out in hives after taking these vitamins.  I couldn't sleep because I was scratching so bad.  My heart skipped beats.  One little scratch would bleed for hours.  My bowel movements were way more difficult than after taking other prenatal vitamins.

column2: luz, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Very, very difficult to open. You need scissors. They need to redesign package

column2: kiianae, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Company needs to redesign packaging. Extremley difficult to open package. I had to use scissors often!

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: Anemia even after taking this medication and has to take an additional iron supplement.Package is difficult to be opened.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It seems to work for me. But the package is very difficult to open.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took this vitamin for 3 months. I did not experience any of the listed side effects. Though, I did develop blurred vision and an incredibly irritated butt from difficult bowel movements. All symptoms disappeared  completely within three days of taken a different vitamin.
Excellent well tolerable vitamin! Highly recomended!
